Returns: true if the input argument matches the predicate, otherwise false
test(int).Description: Evaluates this predicate on the given argument.

Returns: a composed predicate that represents the short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and the other predicate
Parameters: IntPredicate: a predicate that will be logically-ORed with this predicate
or(java.util.function.IntPredicate).Description: Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and another. When evaluating the composed predicate, if this predicate is true, then the other predicate is not evaluated. Any exceptions thrown during evaluation of either predicate are relayed to the caller; if evaluation of this predicate throws an exception, the other predicate will not be evaluated.

Returns: a predicate that represents the logical negation of this predicate
negate().Description: Returns a predicate that represents the logical negation of this predicate.

Returns: a composed predicate that represents the short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate and the other predicate
Parameters: IntPredicate: a predicate that will be logically-ANDed with this predicate
and(java.util.function.IntPredicate).Description: Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate and another. When evaluating the composed predicate, if this predicate is false, then the other predicate is not evaluated. Any exceptions thrown during evaluation of either predicate are relayed to the caller; if evaluation of this predicate throws an exception, the other predicate will not be evaluated.

ClassDesc: Represents a predicate (boolean-valued function) of one int-valued argument. This is the int-consuming primitive type specialization of @B_java#util#function#Predicate_E@. This is a @B_java#util#function#IntPredicate#test_E@.
